meanings.definition: One of the equal parts when a whole is divided into one hundred parts.
meanings.sent1: She ate two hundredths of the cake, leaving the rest for her friends.
meanings.sent2: The recipe called for three hundredths of a teaspoon of salt.
meanings.sent3: The ants worked together to carry the hundredths of a crumb back to their nest.
meanings.sent4: In the tiny world of microbes, a hundredths of a drop of water is like an ocean.
meanings.sent5: The teacher explained fractions using the example of dividing a pizza into hundredths.

meanings.definition: An amount that is one hundred times smaller than a unit.
meanings.sent1: The bacteria multiplied rapidly, increasing their population by a few hundredths.
meanings.sent2: He only had a couple of hundredths of a dollar left in his pocket.
meanings.sent3: The tiny seed grew into a plant, but it was only a hundredths of the size of the others.
meanings.sent4: Her whisper was barely audible, just a hundredths of the noise in the crowded room.
meanings.sent5: The scientist measured the substance in hundredths of a milligram to ensure accuracy.
